content.location: It is on the East side of the Keystone Cave boulder, on the right side of the cave.

content.description: Recession or Depression is a good highball that works up the southwest side of the Keystone Boulder. Start on high crimps and pockets, and make a big move to the first crimp. The holds continue to get better as you work up the face.
content.location: On the side opposite of the cave, this is located on the far left of the face.

content.description: Sit start on low rails, work up and left on a combination of crimps and sidepulls, and top out on easy jugs.
content.location: This ascends the Northwest side of the Keystone Cave Boulder.

content.description: Sit start down in the cave and work your way up the prow. Use big pockety jugs and then do the crux reach at the lip and top out on jugs. Big holds the whole way, but a fall could be pretty uncomfortable towards the top.
content.protection: Pads? To get down, you can go right and jump off the NE corner.

content.description:
This is a savage boulder problem with a few hard moves into a 20 foot victory jug haul.

Start on the crimp rail full of pebbles at the back of the roof, and climb out a couple savage moves on crimps and pinches, exiting right into a jug and heading out the extremely fun topout!
content.protection:
At least 3 pads.

To be edited in.
content.location:
This starts at the back of the roof.

To be edited in.

content.description:
This is a lower start to "

Meat Head

". It starts one move lower on 2 pretty bad crimps then heads straight into the starting crimp rail for

Meat Head

. There are about 3-4 hard moves to a jug haul. It is really fun!
content.protection: A towel so you don't dab on the lowball start.
content.location: It is on the East side of Keystone Cave Boulder.

content.description: Start low on two juggy rails and move up and left to a couple jugs, and then move up to a micro-jug and then mantle over the lip and top out on dirty but okay holds
content.protection: Pads and spotter. The only bad part about this route is that if you fall while mantling over the lip you'll land on the big pointy boulder in the landing.
content.location:
It is 20 feet right of

No Use For a Name

.

content.description: Sit start on jugs to the left, and traverse on the lower slopey rail from left to right.
content.location: It is on the South side of the boulder, or around the left corner from the cave area.

content.description:
Heart of the Storm is another great Sailing Hawks traverse to test your endurance on and is surprisingly good for being left-to-right oriented. Stand start on the left side of the pocketed rail just right of "

Recession or Depression

". Traverse right using cool pockets & edges until the rail rounds the arete under "Flight of the Valkyrie". Downclimb into the chockstone start, and keep it together through the tenuous crux on "

Heart of the Sun

". Continue traversing along the rail, finishing on fun and pumpy jugs and pinches.
content.location: It is on the Keystone Cave Boulder.
